page.title: 06Employment in Simonside
page.content: In a{survey of employment}of 64 adult men it was found that 52% had at some time worked in the{traditional {north-east industries:}31% had been employed in shipbuilding, 14% in heavy engineering and 6% in coal mining. It was found that 16% of the sample are today unemployed. Only 8% are at present employed in traditional industries. 22% of those questioned had been affected by works closure during the last five years and 31% had training in a trade or profession which they no longer use because of {redundancy, works closure}or a change in employment. 50% are today employed in service industries, 20% in manufacturing, 8% in traditional and 6% in professional. In a similar survey of 64 mothers, 39% worked full-time and 31% worked part-time.
